titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to Joel S. Price
CWG13658

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 11; Bundles of AG & QMG Expenditures 1864-65; Bundle 1

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To Joel S Price Dr

row.cell: For Services as Post Surgeon in the Hospital at Frankfort

body.p: I certify that in the month of July 1862 during the first raid of Jno Morgan a number of troops were hastily collected here without surgeons or any hospital accomodations and that Dr Joel S Price was appointed ^post surgeon^ by the officers in command with the approbation of the adjutant General of Ky and by my own as President of the Military Board and that he was in charge of a hospital prepared under his supervision with a number of sick soldiers under his care for which reasons --
I Certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

J B Temple late President of the Military Board
Quarter-Master.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 18"of April, 1865, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-Master General of the State of Kentucky, the sum of One Hundred Dollars and -- Cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

No. 22.
No 135 "B2" Qr. 186.
Joel. S. Price
Dollars 100.x/100
Paid April 18th, 18652.
Medical Services
